GLANCE.full_title: Measurement of the production cross section for Z/gamma* in association with jets in pp collisions at sqrt(s) = 7 TeV with the ATLAS Detector

CDS.comment: This is a draft of a PRD
CDS.abstract: We present results on the production of jets of particles in association with a Z/gamma* boson in the final state, in proton-proton collisions at sqrt{s} = 7 TeV with the ATLAS detector. The analysis includes the full 2010 data set corresponding to an integrated luminosity of 36 pb^-1. Inclusive jet cross sections in Z/gamma* events, with Z/gamma* decaying into electron or muon pairs, are measured for jets with transverse momentum pT >30 GeV and jet rapidity in the region |y | < 4.4. The measurements are compared to next-to-leading-order perturbative QCD calculations, and to predictions from different Monte Carlo generators implementing leading-order matrix elements supplemented by parton showers.
keywords: Jets, Z bosons, QCD, NLO, ALPGEN, SHERPA, MCFM, electrons, muons
CDS.title: Measurement of the production cross section for Z/gamma* in association with jets in pp collisions at sqrt{s}=7 TeV with the ATLAS Detector

CDS.abstract: We present cross-sections for jets produced in association with a $Z$-boson in proton-proton collisions at $\rm \sqrt{s}=7~TeV$. The measurement is performed with 36~\ipb\ of data observed with the ATLAS detector at the LHC. $Z$-bosons are identified using electron and muon decay modes. Jets are reconstructed with the anti-kT algorithm. Inclusive cross-sections, $\sigma(Z+\geq{N\:}{\rm jets})$, are measured for events with a $Z$-boson and N or more jets (N=0-4). Differential cross-sections d$\sigma$($Z$~+~jets)/d$p_T$ are measured with respect to the transverse momenta $p_T$, and to the rapidities of the first, 2nd and 3rd leading jets. In addition, we normalize the total cross section per bin in multiplicity or in $p_T$ to the inclusive $Z$ cross section and calculate ratios $\sigma(Z+\geq{N+1\:}{\rm jets})/\sigma(Z+\geq{N}\:{\rm jets})$ between the inclusive cross-sections, to cancel out systematic uncertainties. The cross-sections and their ratios are corrected for all detector effects and are given for the fiducial, restricted, region of the detector acceptance. We compare the measured cross-sections to next-to-leading order (NLO) pQCD calculations from MCFM and leading-order simulations from ALPGEN, PYTHIA, and SHERPA. The observed cross-sections are found in agreement with the NLO predictions.
CDS.title: Measurement of the cross section for jets produced in association with Z bosons

comment: Comments: 48 pages plus author list (60 pages in total), 26 figures, 20 tables, submitted to Physical Review D
48 pages plus author list (60 pages in total), 26 figures, 20 tables, submitted to Physical Review D
abstract: Results are presented on the production of jets of particles in association with a Z/gamma* boson, in proton-proton collisions at sqrt(s) = 7 TeV with the ATLAS detector. The analysis includes the full 2010 data set, collected with a low rate of multiple proton-proton collisions in the accelerator, corresponding to an integrated luminosity of 36 pb^-1. Inclusive jet cross sections in Z/gamma* events, with Z/gamma* decaying into electron or muon pairs, are measured for jets with transverse momentum pT > 30 GeV and jet rapidity |y| < 4.4. The measurements are compared to next-to-leading-order perturbative QCD calculations, and to predictions from different Monte Carlo generators implementing leading-order matrix elements supplemented by parton showers.

Results are presented on the production of jets of particles in association with a Z/gamma* boson, in proton-proton collisions at sqrt(s) = 7 TeV with the ATLAS detector. The analysis includes the full 2010 data set, collected with a low rate of multiple proton-proton collisions in the accelerator, corresponding to an integrated luminosity of 36 pb^-1. Inclusive jet cross sections in Z/gamma* events, with Z/gamma* decaying into electron or muon pairs, are measured for jets with transverse momentum pT > 30 GeV and jet rapidity |y| < 4.4. The measurements are compared to next-to-leading-order perturbative QCD calculations, and to predictions from different Monte Carlo generators implementing leading-order matrix elements supplemented by parton showers.
CDS.title: Measurement of the production cross section for $Z/\gamma^*$ in association with jets in pp collisions at $\sqrt{s}$ = 7 TeV with the ATLAS detector
